rounds.comments: (Alex: And you're going to love this one...)

clues.text: Office workers in Africa might take a break for kahawa, this beverage
Lala is not a Teletubby but this; you'll need some after a long, hard day on safari
Dudu is the generic term for this kind of 6-legged pest; the repellent for them is dawa ya wadudu
Elton John & Tim Rice found this term for "no worries" in a Swahili phrase book & wrote a song about it
Moja is the number one, kumi is ten, & kumi na moja is this
Old masters could grind up hematite or cinnabar to make shades of this primary color
The ancients called jade lapis nephriticus, as they thought it a stone that could cure this organ's ailments
You can find caledonite in this country that lent its ancient name to the mineral
A beryl named for a New York financier isn't johnite or pierpontite, but this
Antimony is the usual base of this dark eye shadow used by Middle Eastern women
Graham Nash did a very, very, very fine job writing this Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young song
It was the Talking Heads' biggest U.S. hit
Finishing the title of the 1991 Garth Brooks hit "Two of a Kind, Workin' On..."
This song was a hit for John Mellencamp in 1984: ain't that America?
In 1968 Glen Campbell sang of "The Dreams of" this woman
Lurleen Burns married this man when she was 16 & later succeeded him as governor of Alabama
Before "Braveheart" his story was told in the 15th century by Henry the Minstrel
(Hi, I'm Wallace Langham)  Mike's son, this broadcaster became NBC News White House Correspondent in 1982
He & his wife Lila launched Reader's Digest in 1922 with a press run of 5,000
"The Emperor of Ice-Cream" is a famous work by this poet whose day job was VP of an insurance company
This guardian of Tom Sawyer was based on Mark Twain's mother
Richard Wright's 1940 tale about Bigger Thomas
Howard Garis wrote the Tom Swift adventure books & created this character whose last name is Longears
Title question a baby bird asks of everything in sight in a P.D. Eastman "Beginner Book"

Gee, dig her!
In 1962 federal employees were given the right to organize, but not the right to do this, as other workers can
In 1802 England passed the first law against this type of labor that Dickens attacked in "Oliver Twist"
All together now!  Most of the gains labor unions get in the U.S. are achieved through this process
The 1969 Nobel Peace Prize went to the Intl. Labor Organization, an agency of this body
The NALC is the "National Association of" these, & you have to give them their postage due
In 1997 this star of "Private Benjamin" made her directing debut with the TV movie "Hope"
This "Annie Hall" actress went behind the cameras for the 1995 family drama "Unstrung Heroes"
This actor directed an animal onscreen & off in 1998's "The Horse Whisperer"
Like Olivier, this actor made his debut as a film director with Shakespeare's "Henry V"

who went through Hell

Fake flowers Marie Osmond sang about in 1973
Little Boy Blue slept under one
The Hebrew name for this taboo meat is basar chazir
Encarta says clothes with a high content of this plastic fiber "became popular in the 1970s"
It was found that its impurity measured only .56% of its weight, so it was advertised as "99-44/100% Pure"
Mining of this mineral began in Death Valley in 1883 with 20-mule teams dragging it out
French for "good friend", this polishing soap "Hasn't Scratched Yet"
Originally, this bar's pumice was imported from the Italian island of Lipari
Its ad lines have said, "It Won't Dry Your Face Like Soap" & it "Is 1/4 Cleansing Cream"
You might get needled by this 4,000-year-old technique in widespread use at Chinese hospitals
Without using a hammer, it's this person's job to knock you out in the O.R.
Smile!  A photograph was taken of you with one of these photon streams that's also known as a Roentgen Ray
Founded in the 600s A.D., the oldest hospital still in existence is the Hotel Dieu in this city

rounds.text: 3 of the states that have areas known as "panhandles"
rounds.response: (3 of) Texas, Oklahoma, Florida, West Virginia, Idaho, Alaska & Maryland
